document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Tricholabiodes Radoszkowski, 1885 (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) from Saudi Arabia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Tricholabiodes Radoszkowski, 1885 (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) from Saudi Arabia

heading.emphasis:
Tricholabiodes aldryhimi Soliman
, sp. nov. (
Figs 1–13
)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype ♂: SAUDI ARABIA , Rawdhat Farshet Sheaal (Al-Aflag) [
22 ° 24 ' 56 "N
,
46 ° 35 ' 17 "E
], 602 m , LT No.
3, 4
.VIII. 2015 (leg. Al Dhafer et al .) [ KSMA ]. Paratypes : SAUDI ARABIA ,
9 ♂
with the same label as holotype [ KSMA ];

, Rawdhat Farshet Sheaal (Al-Aflag) [ 22 ° 24 ' 22 ",
46 ° 35 ' 35 "E
], 596 m , LT No.
0, 4
.VIII. 2015 (leg. A.M. Soliman) [ KSMA ];

: Rawdhat Farshet Sheaal (Al-Aflag) [

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1−4.
Tricholabiodes aldryhimi
sp. nov.
, holotype (♂): 1. Habitus, dorsal view; 2. Head, frontal view; 3. Fore wing; 4. Mid right-leg and hind right-femur.

FIGURES 5−10 .
Tricholabiodes aldryhimi
sp. nov.
, holotype (♂): 5. Mid and hind coxae, ventral view; 6. T2−T6; 7. S2−S8; 8. Metasomal segments 1−7, lateral view; 9. S2−S4; 10. T6−T7.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The male of
T. aldryhimi
sp. nov.
resembles that of
T. brothersi
Lelej, 2010
in having a bifurcal process on S 3 but it differs from it by the following: head, mesosoma and metasomal first segment reddish brown, remainder of metasoma dark brown, last 2 segments slightly lighter (body straw-coloured in
T. brothersi
); fore wing with second submarginal cell medium sized and pentagonal (very small and quadrangular in
T. brothersi
); bifurcal process on S 3 sessile and not extending beyond S 3 (bifurcal process on S 3 petiolate and slightly extending beyond S 3 in
T. brothersi
,
Fig. 14
); inner margin of genital paramere suddenly sinuate apically (straight throughout in
T. brothersi
,
Fig. 15
); base of paramere subtriangular in lateral view (cylindrical in
T. brothersi
,
Fig. 16
); inner margin of penial valve broadly concave throughout (strongly concave on apical half in
T. brothersi
,
Fig. 15
).
Etymology. This species is dedicated to Prof. Yousif N. Aldryhim (Plant Protection Department, College of Food and Agriculture Sciences, King Saud University).
